## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've got a question about quantum secure addresses. I've heard that if I upgrade to one, it will only secure the latest 100 transactions sent to my identity name/address. Is that true?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, that's a misconception. Upgrading to a quantum secure address will retroactively secure **all** transactions sent to your identity name/address, not just the latest 100. This means that if you have 1000 transactions sent to your identity, the upgrade will secure all 1000 of them.

**User:**
That's great to know! I was worried I'd have to re-secure all my previous transactions manually. Speaking of which, will I need to manually re-secure each of my previous transactions when I upgrade to a quantum secure address!?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you won't need to manually re-secure each of your previous transactions. Upgrading to a quantum secure address will retroactively secure all previous transactions sent to your identity name/address, so you won't need to take any additional steps to secure them. The upgrade will take care of everything for you.
